overview_of_class: This course covers: groups and their structure; polynomial rings; algebraic field extensions; introduction to Galois theory. The ultimate goal of the course is the proof of the insolubility of the quintic equation in radicals. Considerable emphasis will be put on examples, computations, and the historical development of the subject.
name: Abstract Algebra
title: SCS MATH 330-A-62 Abstract Algebra

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers: groups and their structure; polynomial rings; algebraic field extensions; introduction to Galois theory. The ultimate goal of the course is the proof of the insolubility of the quintic equation in radicals. Considerable emphasis will be put on examples, computations, and the historical development of the subject.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Math 300 or a similar course dealing with foundational mathematics, or consent of the instructor.

subject: MATH
